Senior Data Programmer / Data Quality - Oracle/ SQL

div.div: Analysis, CRM, Database, Data Warehouse, HTTP, Inquire, Management, Materials, Networks, Oracle, Programmer, Programming, Research, Scheduling, Scripts, SQL, Unix, Validation

br.br:
The Senior Data Programmer is responsible for working with clients and BSA's to provide the highest quality products and services to our internal and external customers. Works on assignments that are complex in nature and where considerable judgment is required in resolving problems and making recommendations. The Sr. Data Programmer is responsible for new and existing data and data validation assignments that are complex in nature where considerable judgment and initiative are required in resolving problems and making recommendations.
Essential Functions
Generates adhoc reports and regular datasets or report information for end-users using system tools and database or data warehouse queries and scripts
Integrates data from multiple sources to produce requested or required data elements
Programs and maintains report forms and formats, information dashboards, data generators, canned reports, and other end-user information portals or resources
Receives and process input feeds
Verifies input data quality, including identification and communication of file variances and potential issues
Performs file transfers and performs backup procedures
Sends all outputs to appropriate location
Manages the quality and timeliness of updates and output deliverables
Ensures compliance with production standards and tests/Quality Controls the solution(s)
Develops specifications and use them to design/code a solution
Uses and fully understands established appropriate processes to meet customer requirements, and be able to customize if required
Verifies program execution is successful
Proactively identifies areas for improving processes and client service
Focus on meeting and exceeding client expectations
May create specifications for reports based on business requests
Knowledge & Skills
Strong written and oral communication and organizational skills
Ability to deliver presentations and updates to clients. Must be comfortable in a client facing environment.
Flexible and adaptable in regards to learning and understanding new technologies
Ability to conduct research into software-related issues and products
Highly self-motivated and directed
Proven analytical and problem solving abilities
Strong understanding of data structures, databases, data processing
Able to complete data merges
Able to complete quality control measures, to ensure data integrity
Strong scripting and programming skills
Able to advise less experienced peers
Duties & Responsibilities
Act as team resource for troubleshooting data related issues and problems
Where answers are not immediately known, inquire with appropriate subject matter experts for the answer
Mentor co-workers in business rules as well as the use of processing tools
Assist in developing training materials and classes
Organize, implement, audit, and improve workflows for existing and new clients
Coordinate internally and externally in regards to scheduling and data issues, keeping management abreast of pertinent details
Suggest areas for improvement to internal processes and carry out implementation where applicable
Assist in meeting production schedules
Create and run reports on data and audit content
Create data transformation mappings
Perform data converts, sorts, merge/purges and segmentations as per established standards, procedures and operational guidelines
Technical Requirements
Data reporting and analysis experience desired
Experience with data integration process required
Preferred Qualifications
Familiarity with UNIX operating systems and direct mail processing a plus
Experience
Requires a minimum of 5 years of related experience
Education
High school or equivalent required
Associate’s or Bachelor’s degree preferred
Qualifications
Conditions of Employment
All job offers are contingent upon successful completion of certain background checks which unless prohibited by applicable law may include criminal history checks, employment verification, education verification, drug screens, credit checks, DMV checks (for driving positions only) and fingerprinting.
Great People, Deserve Great Benefits
We know that we have some of the brightest and most talented associates in the world, and we believe in rewarding them accordingly. If you work here, expect competitive pay, comprehensive health coverage, and endless opportunities to advance your career. From tuition reimbursement to scholarship programs to employee stock purchase plans and 401(k)s, we offer associates a variety of benefits that work as hard for them as they work for us.
About Epsilon
Epsilon® is an all-encompassing global marketing innovator. We provide unrivaled data intelligence and customer insights, world-class technology including loyalty, email and CRM platforms and data-driven creative, activation and execution. Epsilon’s digital media arm, Conversant, is a leader in personalized digital advertising and insights through its proprietary technology and trove of consumer marketing data, delivering digital marketing with unprecedented scale, accuracy and reach through personalized media programs and through CJ Affiliate, one of the world’s largest affiliate marketing networks. Together, we bring personalized marketing to consumers across offline and online channels, at moments of interest, that help drive business growth for brands. Recognized by Ad Age as the #1 World’s Largest CRM/Direct Marketing Network, #1 Largest U.S. Agency from All Disciplines and #1 Largest U.S. Mobile Marketing Agency, Epsilon employs over 8,000 associates in 70 offices worldwide.
